title: Manufacturing Team Lead
description:
Exeger is making sustainable energy more accessible for people around the globe with the vision to touch the lives of a billion people by 2030. Our innovative product, Powerfoyle, is the world’s only fully customizable solar cell. Our customers, 3M, Urbanista, Adidas Headphones, POC and others, use it to power their most loved products.
 



  





**ABOUT THE POSITION** 




 Production is the heart of Exeger and is where we manufacture our solar cells to meet customer expectations for product quality, cost and delivery – maximizing efficiency and driving excellence. The Manufacturing Team Lead, as part of the production team, ensures manufacturing processes run reliably and efficiently.
 



  





**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES** 




 As our new Manufacturing Team Lead you are responsible for your team and assembly line, making sure that processes run efficient and in accordance with set objectives upholding quality and yield. Areas of responsibilities include:
 


* Managing a team of 20-25 production operators
* Lead daily improvement meeting with manufacturing teams and Production Managers.
* Organize trainings for new SOP and machines in production to maintain competence matrix
* Maintain and improve production systems, e.g. ERP system, OEE system, 5S
* Release new SOP and WO including quantity, yield etc.
* Participate in weekly meetings production plan approval meetings
* Collect and report KPIs on daily and monthly basis.



  





**WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?** 




 We believe that you are a natural leader with an interest to improve and develop the team as well as routines and processes. You have a strong business acumen and are goal- and result driven and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. In addition, we believe that you see possibilities instead of problems. To succeed in this role, we see that you have:
 


* Previous experience from managing teams within the manufacturing industry.
* Used to leading people through change
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken



  





**WHY EXEGER** 




 We are on an exciting journey to bring our groundbreaking solar cell technology to the world. Sprung out of the solid Swedish industrial heritage, we are now in the stage of industrializing at scale to create real, impactful change. We embrace differences and our behaviours are all about being curious, determined, responsible and being yourself. We are passionate about our technology and being part of building the next generation of clean green industry.
 



  





**WHAT NOW** 




 Please send your application via Exeger’s career page. If you do not have a resume at hand, you are welcome to apply with your LinkedIn-profile.

title: Strategic Account Executive (Nordics)
description:
Our Strategic Account Executives target and close new business with Datadog’s largest, most strategic customers and prospects. In this role you’ll be focused on uncovering the pain points organizations face as they operate in or migrate to a cloud environment at scale as well as delivering the appropriate Datadog solution.
   

  

*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*
**What You’ll Do:**
* Prospect into large Fortune 1000 companies while running an efficient sales process
* Maintain, build and own specific relationship maps for your territory including existing relationships and aspirational contacts
* Develop a deep comprehension of customer's business
* Negotiate favorable pricing and business terms with large commercial enterprises by selling value and ROI
* Handle existing customer expectations while expanding reach and depth into assigned territory
* Demonstrate resourcefulness when faced with challenges that defy easy solution
* Have intuitive sense of necessary steps to close business and gain customer validation
* Identify robust set of business drivers behind all opportunities
* Ensure high forecasting accuracy and consistency


**Who You Are:**
* Someone with 3+ years closing experience (mix of field selling within mid-market and enterprise)
* Driven and have met/exceeded direct sales goals of 1M+ and operated with an average deal size of $100k+
* Able to demonstrate methodology to prospect and build pipeline on your own
* Experienced in working for an innovative tech company (SaaS, IT infrastructure or similar preferred)
* Experienced in selling into large Fortune 1000 companies with the ability to win new logos
* Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites
* Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 70% of the time


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**Benefits and Growth:**
* High income earning opportunities based on self performance
* New hire stock equity (RSU) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message
* Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
* An inclusive company culture, opportunity to join our Community Guilds
* Generous and competitive medical benefits package
* Retirement savings match
* Pet adoption and insurance program


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*
 This is a remote position
   

  

**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 190 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 You will be a part of one of the biggest internal SEO & Content teams in the Nordics (part of our marketing organization) responsible for driving traffic to our 15 e-commerce stores present in 7 markets. In this role you will play a crucial role in the execution of improving our organic visibility in the US market. You will get the chance to be part of setting the SEO strategy for, including managing all SEO activities, link building and keyword strategy to increase rankings. We are one of the market leaders in SEO practices and you will work with best-in-class colleagues that can offer loads of knowledge exchange.
   

  

 The demand for healthier alternatives to smoking has never been higher. To make Haypp Group excel you’ll work closely with all other functions within the marketing department, but also with a lot of other stakeholders around the organization. As we are scaling there is a lot of potential in this role and responsibility. Both in terms of growing on a personal level, but also in getting opportunities to work with completely new and unexplored parts of SEO. As of now we are operating on 7 different markets but are planning to add a number to that list in a close future.
   

  

 This position is focusing on continuing our impressive performance in the US market with our two storefronts. The US market is the world’s fastest growing market in our category (and it has just started) and usually the first market for Google to experiment changes in the SERP. It is great timing to be a part of setting the strategy and focus for the market and our continuous success as the market grows.
   

  

 You will be a part of our central team in Stockholm working closely with the US team based in Washington. You will lead the SEO market team for US based in the Stockholm office. Due to the time difference, it will require a few evening meetings and visiting the team in the US.
   

  

 If you are all about SEO and looking for a real challenge, this is the role for you!
   

  

**What We Want From You**
 For the role as Senior SEO Specialist we are looking for a passionate and data driven search marketer with extensive background in strategic SEO, technical SEO, and content strategy. We expect you to come with a strong understanding of the evolution of search and the benefits of thinking about search holistically.
   

  

 In order to succeed in this role, we believe that you possess the following qualifications:
   

  

* + 5 years SEO experience from e-commerce
* Experience of managing SEO projects with different stakeholders
* Ability to perform technical SEO audits and health-checks
* Experience from roles that include leadership
* Ability to perform keyword research, on-page optimization and content recommendations
* Competitive performance - in technical SEO, offsite SEO and onsite SEO/content - for opportunities, and potential threats
* Good understanding of content- and link audits
* Solid experience from working in SEO-tools such as Ahrefs, Screaming Frog and Google Search Console
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken


**Bonus qualifications:**
* Experience in international SEO
* Develop ad hoc reports in various platforms (e.g. Google Sheets, Data Studio etc.)
* Reporting skills / strong analytical skills


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 790 000 consumers.

title: SBA-/Brandskyddssamordnare
description:
Som SBA-/Brandskyddssamordnare planerar och utvecklar du SBA-arbetet i organisationen. Det är viktigt att du kan kontrollera och drifta brandlarms- och sprinkleranläggning samt förstå hur de olika systemen samverkar med fastighetens övriga system. Du ansvarar för månadskontroller och kvartalsprover för brandlarm samt sprinkler och för att styrdokumentbrandskydd följs.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har goda kunskaper inom relevanta lagar och regelverk, särskilt lagen om skydd mot olyckor. Goda kunskaper inom relevanta IT-system och Office är också viktigt då du är systemansvarig för L&T:s SBA-system.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Vidareutbildning enligt SBF:s utbildning ”brandskyddsledare 1” eller motsvarande
* Gymnasieutbildning med yrkesexamen eller med högskolebehörighet.
* Minst ha svenska brandskydds-föreningens utbildning ”egenkontroll” eller liknande.
* Utbildning föreståndare brandfarlig vara
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet och minst 5 års fördjupad kunskap inom brandskyddsarbete, gärna inom vårdmiljö. Erfarenhet av att planera och följa upp brandskyddsarbete.
* God svenska i tal och skrift.
* B-Körkort.


**Meriterande**
* Heta Arbeten, Fallskydd, Första hjälpen, Anläggningsskötare brandlarm och sprinkler
* Grundläggande kunskaper i ABFF/AFF


 Vi söker en SBA samordnare som vill bidra i ett engagerat team om totalt ca 15 medarbetare som med driftuppdrag för våra två sjukhus som ligger i norra Stockholm. Vi satsar mycket på lagutveckling och utbildningar då sjukhus är en strategisk del av vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer och önskar därför få din ansökan så snart som möjligt. När du skickat in din ansökan får du ett bekräftelsemail.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta platschef Patrik Heikkilä på telefonnummer 0730 756 014
   

  

*Vi undanber oss all kontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.*

title: SAP S2P / Business Network Consultant - TIetoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Vill du vara en del av ett snabbt växande globalt team med all sin karriärpotential och bidra till att nå våra tillväxtmål? Om svaret är ja, har vi en perfekt roll för dig!
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren SAP S2P och Business Network konsult till vårt team. I rollen har personen som vi söker helst en god förståelse för upphandlings- och inköpsprocesser inklusive SAP-anpassning samt dokumentation och testning. Erfarenhet av andra moduler som SD eller WM anses vara meriterande.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder en fantastisk möjlighet att lära sig och växa med utmanande kundcase hos oss på Tietoevry som är ett av de ledande företagen inom SAP-verksamhet i Norden. Vi vill främja kreativitet så att du kan komma med dina idéer och påverka vår verksamhetsexpansion. I denna tjänst, och i Tietoevry i allmänhet, får du arbeta i en global miljö med professionella kollegor. Vi arbetar i nära samarbete med våra globala nordiska kunder inom detaljhandel, tillverkning och skogsindustri
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Implementera och hantera SAP S2P och Business Network för våra kunder.
* Integration med andra SAP-moduler
* Arbeta nära intressenter för att sammanställa verksamhetskrav- och funktionsspecifikationer.
* Applikationssupport för både SAP S2P och Business Network
* Delta i kundworkshops


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Beprövad erfarenhet som SAP S2P och Business Network -konsult, specifikt av SAP Ariba-konfiguration
* Erfarenhet av både SAP S2P och Business Network implementeringsprojekt
* God förståelse för upphandlings- och inköpsprocesser
* Utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga för att lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställt inför.
* Förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete.


**Språk:**
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga på svenska och engelska (andra språk är meriterande)


**Vad du kan förvänta dig av oss:**
 Vi erbjuder dig spännande och utvecklande projekt som ger dig möjlighet att arbeta inom olika branscher så som detaljhandel, tillverkning och skogsindustri. Du får skapa framtiden med oss i en växande och snabbt utvecklande sektor. Som leverantör av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster tror vi på att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att möjliggöra din framgång. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter en öppen kultur där vi trivs med att jobba och utvecklas tillsammans i team och våra konsulter utvecklar i projekten sina individuella färdigheter. Vi använder en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell som en del av vårt arbetssätt. På Tietoevry strävar vi efter ett öppet klimat där vi lägger stor vikt vid att se nyfikenhet och lärandet som en viktig del av arbetslivet.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
**Om Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att skapa en digital framtid där vi, konsultbolag, våra konsulter och kunder går igenom en betydlig transformation.
   

  

 Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.
   

  

 Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott

title: Software Development Manager, Low Latency Streaming (Sye) Protocol, Prime Video & Studios Core Tech
description:
**Description**
 Come build the future of entertainment with us. Are you interested in helping shape the future of movies and television? Do you want to help define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?
   

  

 Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.
   

  

 We provide Prime Video customers with low latency streaming for major events. Serving our customers on the biggest live sporting events like the English Premier League, Thursday Night Football and UEFA Champions League to Prime Video customers across the globe with an unparalleled experience. Our customers receive live content in less than 10 seconds and benefit from our pioneering features for low latency and synchronized playback.
   

  

 We are looking for a talented Software Development Manager to lead the development of Prime Video’s Live Low latency Video stack (Sye). You will manage a team that owns the core streaming service of the solution: the Sye Streaming Engine. The protocol is UDP based and developed in C++. It has high demands on functionality, performance, robustness, compatibility and maintainability. The Sye Streaming Engine handles the quality of experience of live streaming along with dynamic and programmatic ad insertion.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 The manager will be leading a team of engineers to utilise Agile methodologies to deliver software projects for the team.
   

  

 The manager will be responsible for writing the team's three year vision, product roadmaps, working backwards artefacts, ensuring operational excellence in the team, and contributing as part of the Sye leadership group.
   

  

 A key responsibility for the manager will be the career development of the engineers in the team, managing performance, promotions and champion best practices and innovation.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 You will be working with your team of talented engineers to solve complex problems to benefit Prime Video Customers. Helping to design and implement solutions for low latency streaming that will run on record breaking live events globally.
   

  

 The manager will be part of the team's ceremonies, such as stand up, sprint planning, retro and demo. They will facilitate operational reviews and team meetings and 1 to 1 sessions.
   

  

 A manager will be an active participant in the Sye organisation through attending review meetings, goal reviews, project update meetings and customer sessions.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our team manages the end to end low latency streaming offering for prime video. We are located across London, Seattle, and Stockholm Sweden. Relocation to Sweden is also possible.
   

  

 We have a diverse range of people and skills in our org, which gives us all new ways to learn how to solve difficult, complex and ambiguous problems.
   

  

 We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

 Stockholm, SWE
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience.
* Experience leading a group of software engineers in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.
* A proven track record of software delivery through all phases of development and developing long-term development and business technology strategies
* Demonstrable knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
* Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategies


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in development of transport protocols over IP
* Experience in video streaming
* Experience in Linux
* Experience with CDNs Edge Computing
* Experience in Ad Tech


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Corporate Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A2583928

title: Tjänstespecialist Katalogtjänst HSA
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som ägs av regionerna och kommunerna i Sverige, med uppdrag att utveckla välfärden. Vår roll är att vara den nationellt sammanhållande parten inom kommunernas och regionernas digitala utveckling. Vi skapar förutsättningar för samordning, förenkling och framför allt effektivisering av regionernas och kommunernas digitaliseringsarbete, med visionen att dessa i sin tur kan ge invånarna en trygg och jämlik välfärd. Hos oss jobbar en mängd människor med bland annat olika slags it-kompetens, kunskap om arkitektur och digital infrastruktur, medicinsk sakkunskap och juridik. Visste du att det är vi som driver och utvecklar 1177?
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Katalogtjänst HSA är en elektronisk katalog som innehåller kvalitetssäkrade uppgifter om verksamheter och medarbetare hos organisationer verksamma inom svensk vård och omsorg. Informationen i HSA används av många olika tjänster inom vård och omsorg, exempelvis inom 1177 och utgör ett viktigt underlag för behörighetsstyrning, säkerhetslösningar och vårdsöktjänster.
   

  

 Vi söker en  senior tjänstespecialist till vår HSA Förvaltning. I rollen ingår olika uppgifter inom ramen för vårt regelverksarbete, såsom att leda/dokumentera internrevisioner och riskanalyser samt att ansvara för vår revision av HSA-anslutna organisationer. Beroende på vad du har för profil kan rollen också innebära uppgifter inom användarstöd, anslutning, innehållsfrågor och utredningar eller utökat informationssäkerhetsarbete. Hos oss blir du del av ett kompetent förvaltningsteam i en spännande tid då vi närmar oss lansering av en ny teknisk plattform för kataloger.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Du trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk och föränderlig miljö och har en hög grad av självledarskap. Du har lätt att ta till dig ny kunskap och är nyfiken på att utvecklas. Du har förmågan att balansera risker och affärsintressen med en utvecklad analytisk förmåga och fokus på problemlösning. Du tycker om att skapa struktur och är duktig på att dokumentera. Kommunikation med våra användare är central och är en skicklig kommunikatör som enkelt kan läsa av, förstå och nå ut till mottagare med anpassad kommunikation beroende på mottagarens förutsättningar och behov.
   

  

 Du har relevant universitetsutbildning, alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Du behöver ha flerårig erfarenhet av förvaltning av IT-system. En extra fördel är om du någon gång under din karriär har arbetat med Katalogtjänst HSA och/eller med informationssäkerhet i någon form.
   

  

**Varaktighet och tillträde**
  

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse, vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
   

  

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?** 
  

  

 Sektionschef, Susan Hjelmestam, susan.hjelmestam@inera.se
   

  

 Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén, 072-724 32 81

title: Chef Produktutveckling och Förvaltning
description:
*Anticimex är det moderna serviceföretaget inom skadedjurskontroll, matsäkerhet, fuktkontroll, husbesiktningar och brandskydd. Genom förebyggande åtgärder, ny digital teknik och hållbara lösningar skapar vi hälsosamma miljöer för både företag och privatpersoner runt om i världen. Anticimex har ca 12 000 anställda och finns i 21 länder. I Sverige är vi 1500 medarbetare. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på Anticimex på [https://karriar.anticimex.se/] (https://karriar.anticimex.se/) .*
 Anticimex ska vara bäst på det vi gör, fortsätta driva utvecklingen i branschen samt ge våra kunder professionell och personlig service. Vi värdesätter relationer och tillsammans med våra kunder fortsätter vi arbetet för ett hållbart samhälle. Anticimex har inlett en digitaliseringsresa där vi förändrar en hel industri från traditionellt analog till att idag vara digital i stora delar - allt för kontinuerligt stärka vår kunderbjudande. Nu söker vi dig som lockas av att axla rollen som chef för Produktutveckling och Förvaltning.
   

  

**Vad du gör**
 Som chef för Produktutveckling och Förvaltning blir du en nyckelspelare i att skapa och implementera IT-strategin tillsammans med andra avdelningar. Du rör dig i gränslandet mellan strategiska frågeställningar, taktiska överväganden samt operativ förståelse och hantering. Rollen har även ett stort fokus på ledarskap, teknik, samarbete och förbättringsarbete. Du leder och coachar en grupp av tjugotalet IT-experter inom det agila ramverket, ITIL och projektmetodik. Tillsammans med andra avdelningar arbetar ni för att säkerställa att IT-miljön är effektiv och säker. Du bygger relationer och ansvarar för leverantörsstyrning, upphandling och avtalsdiskussioner inom relevanta områden.
   

  

 Tack vare din erfarenhet av analys och utvärdering av befintliga system, processer, avtal och interna resurser så identifierar du nya möjligheter till löpande förbättring och effektivisering.
   

  

**Vem du är**
 Du är bra på att motivera din omgivning och uppmuntra till självledarskap. Du gillar att driva förändring, är kommunikativ, kreativ och affärsinriktad. Du brinner för teknik samtidigt som du inspirerar och uppmuntrar dina medarbetare till innovation, omvärldsbevakning och kompetensutveckling.
   

  

 För att lyckas ser vi att du besitter
   

  

* Kompetens inom ledarskap
* Gedigen bredd och kompetens inom affärssystem
* Kompetens inom molntjänster och molnplattformar
* Erfarenhet av det agila ramverket och ledarskap inom agila organisationer
* Stark analytisk förmåga vilket underlättar dina prioriteringar och beslutsfattande
* Akademisk examen inom teknik (Datateknik, Informationsteknik, Data och systemvetenskap, Affärssystem, Ingenjör, eller dylikt)
* Erfarenhet arbete inom IT- och cybersäkerhet


**Vad du får**
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö med goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling
* Frihet att ta ansvar och möjlighet att påverka
* Engagerat ledarskap
* Tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och förmånspaket från Benify


**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi hanterar ansökningar, urval och intervjuer fortlöpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer tillsammans med ditt CV att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. I vissa av våra rekryteringar använder vi oss även av ett urvalstest (personlighetstest). Om vi utifrån din ansökan bedömer att du skulle passa bra i rollen så kommer vi att kontakta dig för en avstämning. Om vi denna gång inte anser dig vara rätt för rollen, så kommer du självklart också att få återkoppling från oss.
   

  

 Vi vill att vår arbetsplats ska vara en spegling av samhället och eftersträvar mångfald, därför uppmanar vi alla kvalificerade kandidater att söka tjänsten. Välkommen till Anticimex!

title: Senior link building specialist
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 190 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are seeking a mastermind in link building for our e-commerce stores. Organic visibility is our primary source of traffic due to the regulatory landscape limiting other marketing channels. It is crucial that we implement the best SEO strategies and have top-tier experts in place.
   

  

 You will be a part of one of the biggest internal SEO & Content teams in the Nordics (part of our marketing organization) responsible for driving all traffic to our 15 e-commerce stores present in 7 markets. In this role you will play a crucial role in the execution of improving our organic visibility. We are one of the market leaders in SEO practices and you will work with best-in-class colleagues that can offer loads of knowledge exchange. The demand for healthier alternatives to smoking has never been higher. To make Haypp Group excel you’ll work closely other stakeholders around the organization. As we are scaling there is a lot of potential in this role and responsibility. Both in terms of growing on a personal level, but also in getting opportunities to work with completely new and unexplored parts of SEO.
   

  

 Given the complexity of our link-building needs, we require someone who can develop and execute robust, data-driven, and scalable strategies. You will be responsible for defining what the next level of link building looks like for us, ensuring that our methods are efficient and scalable as we expand into more markets and add additional storefronts.
   

  

 If you are all about off page SEO and looking for a real challenge, this is the role for you!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and Execute Link Building Strategies: Create and implement comprehensive link-building plans to acquire high-quality backlinks from reputable websites alongside with securing healthy link profile for all our store fronts
* Outreach and Relationship Building: Identify and establish connections with webmasters, bloggers, and industry influencers to secure backlinks.
* Content Collaboration: Work closely with the PR & content team to develop compelling and link-worthy content that attracts top-notch backlinks.
* Analytics and Reporting: Monitor, analyze, and report on the success of link-building campaigns using advanced SEO tools. Provide detailed reports on the impact of backlink acquisition on organic traffic and search engine rankings.
* Define Best Practices: Keep up-to-date with the latest link-building and SEO trends, algorithms, and best practices to ensure and effective strategies. Set the best practice for Haypp Group cross markets and strive for scalability in everything
* Integration with SEO Tools: Utilize and integrate with popular SEO tools to optimize and track the progress of link-building efforts.
* Visionary mindset: You define the next level creative ideas that in gaining links to our store fronts with smarter and more efficient methods


**What We Want From You**
**In order to succeed in this role, we believe that you possess the following qualifications:**
* A creative person with a holistic mindset and point of view
* Being data driven is a part of your backbone
* Smart competitive analysis – in technical SEO, offsite and onsite SEO/content – for opportunities and potential threats
* Solid experience in link building and SEO with a successful track record of improving website rankings
* Senior SEO profile with +5 years in SEO for e-commerce working with multiple markets
* Strong understanding of SEO tools and algorithms used to identify and target high- quality backlink opportunities.
* Strong SEO and Content strategist
* Solid experience level in SEO-tools such as Ahrefs, Screaming Frog and Google Search Console


**Bonus qualifications:**
* PR and/or journalism experience
* Experience from Multi tier link-building and Authority domain redirects


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 790 000 consumers.

title: People Consulting söker konsulter med intresse för det mänskliga perspektivet av förändring
description:
*We are welcoming English-speaking candidates for this role.*
 På EY får du möjligheten att bygga en karriär lika unik som du. Vi stödjer din resa mot att bli ditt bästa professionella jag genom globala möjligheter och en inkluderande kultur. Vi räknar med din röst och ditt perspektiv för att hjälpa oss och våra kunder att bli ännu bättre. Bli en del av EY och bygg en bättre affärsvärld för alla.
   

  

**Är du en kreativ problemlösare med passion för det mänskliga perspektivet som vill hjälpa organisationer förändras?**
**Då kan detta vara för dig!**
 Vi på EY People Consulting växer och söker nya kollegor som, precis som vi, brinner för att göra intryck och skapa avtryck gällande organisationers mest värdefulla tillgång, den mänskliga.
   

  

**Möjligheten**
 Oavsett om teknik är avgörande för att navigera i ständigt föränderlig arbetsvärld, kommer företag alltid att behöva människor. Vi inom People Consulting anser att människor är nyckeln till framgång i förändring. Vi hjälper bland annat organisationer att förstå om de har rätt personer i rätt roller och hur hanteringen av mänskliga kompetenser underbygger realiserandet av affärsstrategin.
   

  

 Tillsammans med våra kunder skapar vi positiva upplevelser av förändring. Vi stöttar exempelvis i framtagande och implementeringar av strategier för talang- och organisationsutveckling, HR-teknologi, kultur och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Inom People Consulting kommer du att vara en del av ett mångfacetterat team med en bred erfarenhetsbas. I Sverige är vi ca 60 personer baserade i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö, medan vi i Norden är ca 150 personer. People Consulting är en del av EYs globala konsultorganisation med över 120 000 konsulter.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som kan utgå från vårt kontor i Göteborg eller Stockholm, men vi vet att våra medarbetares förutsättningar och preferenser är olika vilket återspeglas i vår framåtlutade modell för hybridarbete med syfte att skapa en mer flexibel arbetsmiljö för dig.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Hos oss kommer du att arbeta i team med andra EY kollegor och direkt med kunder för att adressera utmaningar och möjligheter relaterat till organisation, förändring, HR-teknologi, talang, kultur och ledarskap. Du kommer ta dig an varierande roller så som projektledare, förändringsledare, processledare och facilitator. Hos oss uppmuntras du till att hitta nya affärsmöjligheter och kontinuerligt utveckla dig själv ihop med vår affär och marknadsposition.
   

  

**För att lyckas behöver du**
* Vara passionerad för organisationers mest värdefulla tillgång, den mänskliga
* Ha förmåga att kommunicera det komplexa på ett klart, enkelt och tilltalande sätt
* Kunna lösa problem med hjälp av kreativa, strategiska eller analytiska metoder, tekniker och verktyg
* Vara flexibel, anpassningsbar och trivas med att arbeta i agila miljöer och projekt
* Ha en stark social förmåga samt fallenhet för att bygga starka och tillitsbaserade relationer med såväl kunder som kollegor
* Vara ansvarstagande och proaktiv
* Gilla att arbeta i team och projektform
* Ha ett intresse för att kompetensutvecklas inom ett eller flera av följande områden; förändringsledning, organisationsdesign och utveckling, strategisk planering av arbetskraft, HR-transformationer, HR teknologi samt ledarskaps- och kulturutveckling


**Kvalifikationer för tjänsten**
* Relevant universitetsexamen (exempelvis, men inte begränsad till, ekonomi, HR, ingenjör eller beteendevetenskap)
* 2 – 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet efter examen
* Hög språklig nivå i engelska (tal och skrift)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av projektledning och/eller projektarbete
* Vana av att ha arbetat med kunder och/eller att driva förändring i komplexa situationer
* Omfattande kunskap och erfarenhet av MS Office program så som Word, Powerpoint och Excel.


**Meriterande för tjänsten**
* Erfarenhet från att ha arbetat som managementkonsult eller annan konsultroll
* Goda kunskaper i svenska (tal och skrift)
* Kunskap eller intresse för generativ AI


**Vad EY erbjuder dig**
* Kontinuerligt lärande: Du utvecklar tankesätt och färdigheter som hjälper dig att navigera in i framtiden.
* Framgång så som du definierar den: Vi ger dig verktygen och flexibiliteten, så att du kan göra skillnad på ditt sätt.
* Transformativt ledarskap: Vi ger dig insikter, coachning och självförtroende för att bli den ledare som världen behöver.
* Inkluderande kultur: Du kommer att accepteras för den du är och få möjlighet att använda din röst för att hjälpa andra att hitta sin.


 Läs gärna mer om vad EY kan erbjuda dig på Karriär på EY | EY Sverige, i sociala medier och på karriarbloggen.ey.com.
   

  

**Om ovan stämmer in på dig, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan.**
 Ansök senast den 25 Augusti 2024. Din ansökan ska innehålla personligt brev, CV, betyg från universitet och/eller annan utbildning samt ev. intyg från tidigare arbetsgivare. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Lisa Henning på lisa.henning@se.ey.com Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontaktar du Simon Aspler på simon.aspler@se.ey.com. Ansökningarna kommer att behandlas efter avslutad ansökningsperiod.
   

  

**The exceptional EY experience.** 
**It’s yours to build.**
 At EY we celebrate differences and support it. Our employees bring their authentic selves to work every day. We promote diversity of thought, culture and background, and are committed to creating an inclusive EY environment for all employees. EY is an equal opportunity employer for employees and applicants. EY encourages applications from all backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, nationality, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.
   

  

 If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability in your recruitment process, you may contact us through the Talent Attraction and Acquisition specialist in this advert.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
   

  

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Territory Manager (m/f/d)
description:
**Your Responsibilities**
* Territory business planning:
* Analyzing territory, segmenting targets, account planning
* Action planning:
* Monitoring sales results & establish correcting actions
* Tenders & after sales products
* Opportunity Management & pipeline control
* Continuous market & competitor monitoring
* Ensuring customer progressions along the ISP:
* Utilize progression model
* Train customers in products
* Comply with price policies
* Reporting (CRM & other reporting tools)


**Your qualification**
* +2 years in a similar field sales role or nursing background is essential
* Sales experience within the healthcare industry is desirable
* Documented track record in handling technical complex sales projects
* Outstanding oral and written communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Exemplifies unwavering integrity in interactions with both external and internal stakeholders
* Exceptional organizational and planning abilities, adept at managing multiple demands and priorities effectively
* Committed to personal continuous improvement and development, maintaining a keen focus on growth and enhancement
* 
* Innately self-motivated with a resolute determination to achieve success
* A strong commitment to diversity and inclusion, with the ability to contribute to a culture of Olympus


 We encourage you to apply, even if you do not tick all the boxes!
   

  

**Your Benefits**
* Competitive base salary + monthly bonus
* Company provided pension + health insurance
* Company car, IT equipment for both office & home setup
* Structured Performance reviews and development opportunities
* Sport and culture benefits
* Diverse company events


 We're actively reviewing applications and encourage you to apply if this opportunity fits your career goals. Our talent team will assess your submission and reach out as needed.
   

  

**About Olympus Medical Systems** 
 The Medical Systems Division represents Olympus’ largest business domain and is the global market and technology leader for medical endoscopes. Olympus aims to continuously find better and more economical solutions to medical issues which improve the well-being of patients, enhance the working environment for doctors and nursing staff and help to develop the overall performance of health care providers.

title: Key Account Director
description:
Ebury is a hyper-growth FinTech firm, named in 2021 as one of the top 15 European Fintechs to work for by AltFi. We offer a range of products including FX risk management, trade finance, currency accounts, international payments and API integration.
   

  

**Key Account Director - Stockholm**
**4 days working in the office & 1 day from home**
 Our Key Account Directors are the heartbeat of our sales floor, experts in what they do and role models for how they do it. You’ve put in the hours building client relationships, building your knowledge and building your reputation. Now you’re ready to step up onto a bigger stage to showcase your sales talents with an international brand, inspiring the next generation of FX sales people at Ebury as you lead the charge for new business.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a FX Sales Director, you’ll be focused on building your career in sales, driven by targets and a highly competitive commission structure while making a lasting impression on a vast client base.
   

  

* Originate new business targeting client prospects (£50M+ turnover).
* Sell cash management, FX hedging and payment products.
* Understand the client's business, strategy and challenges to provide the best Ebury solution for their situation.
* Support our strong client relationship/servicing culture through on-going customer contact, written call reports via Salesforce, quality customer service and superior product knowledge


**Why Join us?**
* Industry leading basic salary and the opportunity to quickly increase your earnings through a transparent commission scheme.
* Great product suite including Trade Finance with more products in development
* Rapid career progression and a range of structured career paths including leadership, account management/dealing.
* Training and mentoring from some of the world’s most experienced and successful FX professionals.
* International development opportunities including attending global bootcamps.
* Career development opportunities and support to relocate and work abroad.
* Spacious and modern office in Central Stockholm


**You…**
* Have a proven track record of exceeding sales quotas and market share goals in the FX industry.
* Are able to develop sales strategies, techniques and tactics based on customer feedback and market environment; presenting key selling points, features and benefits.
* Are a skilled negotiator and communicator, able to build and leverage relationships at senior levels, including C-suite, within international companies.
* Are relationship focused, nurturing long-term commercial relationships resulting in repeat business and network referrals.
* Have a good understanding of the needs and goals that a business has from a treasury & budgeting perspective.
* Speak fluent Swedish & English


**About Us**
**Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.**
 Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1300 staff with a presence in more than 20 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.
   

  

 Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.
   

  

 None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.
   

  

*We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.*
*Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.*

title: Norwegian-speaking Customer Service Agent to Petzl
description:
Are you exceptional at delivering service and eager to work in a coordinating role? Do you also have a passion for outdoor activities and adventures? Then the role as a Customer Service Agent might be perfect for you! Petzl, a leading company in climbing and fall protection equipment, is currently looking for a Norwegian-speaking Customer Service Agent to join their team in Kista. Keep reading to discover more about this exciting opportunity.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Petzl
 



  

**City :**
 Kista, Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Customer Service
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Upon agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Petzl is a leading player in fall protection and climbing equipment, operating in many parts of the world. Petzl manufactures equipment for both sport climbers and companies that use their products to work safely. They are currently in an exciting growth phase and have been based in Kista since 2020, where they have their Nordic headquarters. The Kista office has 16 employees, and they have around 1100 employees worldwide.
 


  


 As a Customer Service Agent at Petzl, you will be part of a team of four people representing all Nordic languages and addressing Petzl's customers throughout the Nordic region. In this role, the focus will be on Petzl's Norwegian customers.
 


  


 In the role of Customer Service Agent, you will have broad responsibilities where, in addition to customer service, you will also be responsible for and get involved in logistics-related tasks. Your responsibilities will relate to everything within the customer's case, from when an order is placed until it is delivered, and the invoice is paid.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A pleasant and familial workplace with an open and easy-going atmosphere among all employees
  
* Work in a secure & supportive team
  
* Great development opportunities
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Handle incoming cases via phone, email, and chat
  
* Answer common questions regarding prices, delivery information, quotes, etc.
  
* Administer complaints and payment reminders, and monitor deliveries
  
* Work with administrative logistics-related tasks such as coordinating delivery to the warehouse, reviewing key figures, etc.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Fluency in Norwegian and English, both spoken and written
  
* At least two years of experience in customer service
  
* Some work experience in supply chain or logistics
  
* Experience working with systems like SAP and Salesforce
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience in climbing, either professionally or through a personal interest
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Problem solver
  
* Service-minded
  
* Adaptable
  
* Cooperative
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Petzl**

 Learn more about Petzl here .
   




**Get directly recruited to Petzl**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Sally Ismail or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on recruitmentstockholmsouth@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105586

title: Chef - Hotel At Six
description:
*A team player with an eye for detail and a passion for delivering a culinary experience beyond expectation - does that sound like you? Then you should definitely continue reading…*
**The Magic Starts At Six**
 At Six is a contemporary art and design hotel with 343 rooms and suites, including our Masterpiece Suite and 32 longstay apartments adjacent to the hotel. In the house you will also find - a gym, our wine bar Blanche & Hierta, At Six Cocktail Bar, and our Dining Room, along with our rooftop bar Stockholm Under Stjärnorna. A big part of the hotel is Social At Six, our 3000m2 flexible event and meeting space where the only limits are the ones of your imagination.
   

  

 At Six is a part of Petter Stordalen's hotel group Nordic Hotels & Resorts which also includes the neighbouring hotel Hobo, Sommerro, Villa Copenhagen, The Thief, Copperhill, and Yasuragi among others.
   

  

 At Six is striving to elevate the meaning of hospitality while perfecting the art of details. Today, we’re one of the leading choices for high-end travelers in Scandinavia. Our employees pride themselves in creating the best possible experience for our guests, in a warm and friendly work environment. It’s a simple equation; happy employees = happy and satisfied guests.
   

  

**With a Passion for Modern Gastronomy and the Culinary Experience**
 The Food & Beverage department is pretty much the heart of the hotel. Here you’ll find one restaurant, one bistro, two bars, and a rooftop park, each unique in regards to products, inspiration, and atmosphere, all relentless in their pursuit of culinary excellence. You will most certainly never be bored - your many colleagues and different happenings and events will see to that. Wine makers dinners, conferences, dinner packages and more will keep you on your toes. You will be part of an ambitious and supportive team who understands the importance of good communication. It is the key to our operations running smoothly, both within your team and also across departments.
   

  

**The Role and Our Philosophy**
 As a chef At Six you will be responsible for different sections. We see that you are able to properly prep for service and keep the required production pace while being in sync with your team and also be able to work alone. You will also work on other stations and work day and night shifts. As a part of the job you will handle inventory and make sure to always deliver food of the highest quality. As for all kitchen-staff you have a responsibility to maintain a good level of hygiene, health and safety.
   

  

*Our philosophy is that every detail makes a difference, and the differences make all the details!*
**And what about you?**
 We believe you have a passion for fine dining and creating extraordinary culinary experiences. To always strive to exceed guest expectations is only natural to you and you have a genuine love for food and beverage.
   

  

 You are an organized team player who understands the value of exceptional service and thrives in working together with your team to bring out dishes of the highest quality.
   

  

 You have at least 2 years of experience working in a similar position in a high end restaurant, and it is meritorious if you have experience working in a hotel.
   

  

 To recap, do you have all of the below skills and traits?
   

  

* 2 years experience from a similar position, preferably in fine dining
* A keen eye for detail
* A team player with good communication skills
* Able to communicate well in both Swedish and English


**Let’s get to the good stuff;**
 Our employees, or as we like to call them; our ambassadors, make us who we are. This means we are diverse, reliant and impeccably service minded. As an employer, At Six is encouraging, humble and fun (no really, we are). Here, you will work in a beautiful and inspiring environment with people who you’ll soon call dear friends or empowering mentors. We strive to provide good opportunities for career growth.
   

  

 And to top it off,
   

  

***4 free***
 hotel nights at any Strawberry hotel
   

  

 Employee and Friends & Family room rates
   

  

 Discounts on food and drink for you and your friends
   

  

**Along With Additional Benefits**
 In this day and age, sustainability is most likely something you value. Luckily, so do we. Through the programme We Care, all Strawberry Hotels make sure to facilitate an environment where our employees and planet thrive.
   

  

**Join us!**
 There! With all the mandatory stuff out of the way, let’s talk. Face to face, preferably. Apply below and don’t hesitate to send our Executive Chef Naser Khlef an email at Naser.khlef@hotelatsix.com if you have any questions.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis and the position can be filled before the last application date. So—what are you waiting for? Apply now! Applications can be sent in both in English and Swedish.

title: Director of Brand Marketing
description:
***\* Please note that, due to the summer break, you can expect a delay in our response. We will review your application as soon as possible and aim to start the interviews after the summer.***




  





 For the right candidate, we really believe this could be the best job you’ll ever hold.
 



  





 Precis is an award winning agency born out of Scandinavia in 2012. Today, we are more than 500 people obsessing about ways to help our clients succeed through Media, Data & Analytics, Technology and Creative while fostering a world-class workplace.
 



  





 The Director of Brand Marketing for Media is focused on developing and expanding the Media Solutions business by defining, enhancing, and broadening our brand marketing offering. This role is crucial for fostering growth and elevating our presence in the media solutions industry. With a strong background in media, you will utilize your extensive experience across both paid and organic channels, holistic brand strategy and evaluation, deep knowledge of industry trends, and your proactive mindset to create a shared vision for the future of brand marketing at Precis.”.
 



  





 Internally, you will lead our Media Strategist team and collaborate closely with our Client facing teams to increase the pace of learning and innovation in our collaborations. You will also take on several of our largest clients to focus on building a branding offering that delivers the highest long-term impact of advertising investments. As part of the senior leadership team in the region, you will promote and develop our business by keeping the agency at the forefront of our industry and through leveraging your existing network.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 



* Develop and grow the Media Solutions business at Precis with a particular focus on strategic planning around media investments, the upper funnel, and creative.
* Lead the conversations around media strategy for our biggest clients in the Northern European Region, typically through C-level education and engagement.
* Work closely with key external stakeholders including media platforms to ensure Precis and our clients alike benefit therefrom.
* Develop our service offering, with a deep understanding of the evolving needs and expectations of advertisers across markets and industries.
* Promote and communicate Precis’ Media Solutions offering through external thought-leadership, case studies, events, and networking.
* Drive the creation of original research using data, client cases, and industry insights/trends to demonstrate the effectiveness of our branding and media solutions and identify opportunities for future investments.
* Close collaboration with our matrixed leadership and regional delivery structures to build a collaborative and shared vision and approach to our media business strategy.



  





**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR** 



* You are kind. We are all responsible for making Precis the best it can be and as such need our leaders to set a really high standard in emulating our company principles.
* Extensive (10+ years) in-house or agency experience leading and executing initiatives within branding/upper funnel digital media channels (Precis largest existing managed channels are Google Ads, YouTube, DV360, META, with TikTok, Snap, LinkedIn, and Microsoft Search as growing platforms).
* Ability to combine deep understanding of business objectives and media/audience trends in order to create strategies for growth, optimal budget allocation, and media effectiveness
* Proven track record of growing a media business (agency revenues, managed spend, or media spends/team size if in-house).
* Excellent ability to inspire and lead large groups of specialists and strategists to promote learning, development, and dedication to client success.
* Demonstrated ability to lead through influence and thrive in a matrixed organisational structure.
* Availability to regularly travel across our different locations (Nordics & UK mainly) to visit our office and clients.



  





**WHAT WE OFFER** 



* On several occasions, Precis has been named one of the best workplaces in Scandinavia, and it’s not just because of the excellent coffee; We have really, really kind and talented people working here and we take good care of each other.
* Inclusive Culture: Supportive and inclusive work environment that values diversity and encourages collaboration.
* Professional development: Be at the forefront of marketing know-how, with support from experts across the industry at your fingertips.
* Benefits: Competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and additional perks designed to enhance your work-life balance. You can read our full offering, including our salary bands, in our handbook.
* Innovation: Be part of a dynamic and innovative team that thrives on creativity, experimentation, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in marketing.

title: Project Art Director (PAYDAY 3 Live)
Senior Manager – Social Media, Marketing Strategy & Analytics (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 Social Media Team of Agoda focuses on connecting and engaging millions of our followers on social channels, which includes developing strategy based on data and insights, generating trendy and relevant content, managing key influencers, leading campaign planning and execution. We are a group of collaborative and smart marketers who are both analytical and creative. The team also fosters a great learning environment, you will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 We are seeking you to lead our global social media marketing, you will be responsible for developing and implementing effective social media strategies to connect with our millions of followers on social media, to make Agoda breakthrough on social media, and to generate engagement and ultimately drive conversions.
   

  

 You will gain deep understanding of the Online Travel landscape and operations of a cutting-edge tech company by working closely with product, marketing, and supply teams. Because of the significant impact of these marketing activities have on our overall business, you will have regular interaction with the senior management team, including our CMO, COO, and CEO.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Lead, Shape and implement social media strategies for multiple channels globally, including but not limited to Tiktok, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter
* Consistently ideate, create and curate content with a strong point of view and deep knowledge of Agoda’s brand, using innovative approaches to format, structure and presentation to grow our brand presence and engagement on social
* Use data to inform strategy and detect new opportunities, be experimental with content and campaigns, monitor and analyze social media metrics to measure the success of campaigns and initiatives and make data-centric decisions
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in social media and leverage them to drive growth
* Develop and manage influencer marketing campaigns and social media advertising campaigns


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Prior experience (5+ years) in managing digital marketing channels or a similar role
* Solid expertise in analysis and reporting, analytical thinking abilities shown to drive insights
* Project management experience and fanatical attention to detail
* Effective executive communication style, as demonstrated in both written and verbal formats
* Entrepreneurial spirit/ability and eagerness to try different things with minimal direction


**It’s Great if you have:**
* Strong understanding of OTA business
* Strong understanding of Social Media and Content Marketing

title: Principal Product Manager, Rocket Travel by Agoda (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**About Rocket Travel By Agoda**
 Rocket Travel by Agoda is a travel technology company founded in 2012 under our flagship consumer-facing product, rocketmiles.com. Since then, we have evolved to partner with some of the largest consumer travel brands in the world creating white-label solutions that allow customers to earn and redeem miles and points for booking hotels, rental cars, flights and activities. Our global partnerships range from world-class airlines to international banks to large-scale shopping platforms. We help our partners develop successful go-to-market strategies through marketing expertise and data to support their overall growth.
   

  

 Rocket Travel creates B2C and B2B2C travel products and is part of Booking Holdings (BKNG). We have many worldwide partners and a diversified business. Despite the world’s current situation, Booking Holdings has been rated the healthiest company in travel, and Rocket itself is already seeing travel demand surpass pre-pandemic levels.
   

  

 We attract customers from every corner of the globe with a seamless user experience that’s built in-house from ideation to finished product: our team includes front- and back-end developers, customer service, data analysts, designers, marketers, accountants, partnership sales, and managers.
   

  

**About the role:**
 Rocket Travel is looking for a
 **Principal Product Manager** 
 to join our growing team in the Bangkok office. In this role, you’ll work closely with our engineering and design teams to build new white-label products for our airline and reward partners as well as capabilities to enrich our platforms for all partners. Our Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers.
   

  

**Rocket Travel is a place where you:**
* Work with a group of intrinsically motivated people with a track record for building successful new businesses from scratch.
* Embody being curious, accountability, taking moonshots, & rising together. We live and build products by these values every day.
* Own decisions and take action that can be implemented in a matter of days (or hours).
* Get inspired and encouraged to vacation faster, with an annual vacation stipend.
* Share your passion for travel with equally adventurous teammates.
* Work within the largest online travel company in the world.


**As a Principal Product Manager at Rocket Travel, you will** 
 :
   

  

* Be accountable for your area of our product portfolio, taking ownership of a set of business, customer, and quality goals.
* Work with commercial and partnership stakeholders to identify and define requirements.
* Work with engineering to understand timelines, dependencies, and tradeoffs.
* Work with designers to create lovable customer-centric experiences.
* Create and maintain product dashboards to track performance and trends of KPIs, providing rigorous insights into user behavior.
* Use data to make decisions.
* Receive mentorship from senior product leaders and other senior members of the team
* Work with stakeholders within the company collaboratively to communicate and finalize decisions.
* Create your own path at a fast-growing company.


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* 5+ years of Product Management experience
* Customer and people-focused, optimizing the product from user insights, customer engagement, and both quantitative and qualitative data.
* Data-driven, able to ask the right questions and resourcefully find the answer.
* Background as an Engineer, either in education or work.
* A growth mindset, willing to learn the ins and outs of product management on the fly while building trust and relationships with your teammates.
* Familiar with product development or a related field, even better if you have experience in travel, software, and/or growth-stage organizations.
* Demonstrable comfort with data analysis and the ability to perform moderate to advanced queries
* Hands-on mentality
