title: Vi söker Cybersecurity Advisors
description:
**Vi söker Cybersecurity Advisors**
===================================


**About NetNordic**
-------------------


At NetNordic, we are experts in designing and delivering innovative solutions for critical infrastructure. Specializing in cybersecurity, secure data centers, and secure networks, we provide cloud and infrastructure services that strengthen our customers’ most vital operations. Join us to be a part of a team that turns complexity into simplicity and makes a significant impact in the world of technology.


**Why work at NetNordic?**
--------------------------


At NetNordic, you’ll have the opportunity to work as either a specialist or a generalist, depending on your career goals and interests. We pride ourselves on being objective advisors who strive to provide our clients with the best solutions tailored to their needs.


Are you passionate about technology and eager to engage in all levels of strategy, tactics, and operations? If you thrive on staying at the forefront of cybersecurity and enjoy exploring new technologies, you’ll fit right in.


As our Cybersecurity team expands, we’re looking for talented individuals with a deep and broad expertise in information security. We believe in empowering our team members to take charge of their career development through continuous learning—whether through conferences, certifications, or other educational opportunities.


At NetNordic, we embrace change and innovation, always striving to stay ahead in a dynamic field. If you’re ready to grow with us and tackle exciting challenges, we’d love to meet you!


**What we’re looking for**
--------------------------

  

  

We are seeking team members with extensive knowledge and experience in information security. Ideal candidates will have a strong background in information security practices, risk management, consulting, and market analysis.


Key Skills and Experience:  

While we don’t expect you to know everything, here are the qualifications and skills we’re looking for:


* Deep knowledge of information security principles and practices
* Experience with regulations and standards like NIS2, CER, CIS, and ISO 27000
* Proven ability in risk analysis, security assessments, and strategic consulting
* Strong communication skills for collaborating with clients and stakeholders
* Preferred certifications: CISSP, CISA, CISM

**Your role and responsibilities**
----------------------------------

  

  

In this position, you will lead and conduct various consultancy projects for our clients. Your responsibilities will include:


* Performing GAP analyses to evaluate current security levels against information security standards
* Conducting risk assessments and analyzing potential consequences for information security
* Leading initiatives to enhance and strengthen clients’ information security measures

**Send your application**
-------------------------


Send your application to recruitment.se@netnordic.com – with a short description of your experience and we will contact you!

title: Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
The industry of Banking is changing rapidly. We are going through changes in the cash management area with new competitors, technological development and infrastructure upgrades.

Do you want to join a professional and passionate team that is in the process of further developing the analytical capabilities within SEB Corporate Banking and beyond? Customer expectations in the digital era is putting new requirements on our existing and future data driven advisory products. In this transition we aim to automate, simplify and implement self-service advanced analytics in all areas. We are now looking for a ***Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data***. As part of our Google Cloud migration journey, you will help define account data products that support our reporting and analytics use cases.**About the role:**
As a Data Steward, you will champion data quality, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance for our account data and products. You'll develop and implement innovative data governance frameworks and best practices. By collaborating closely with stakeholders across departments, you'll define and refine data requirements and standards, driving powerful analytics initiatives and turning raw data into actionable insights. Monitoring key data quality metrics and KPIs, you will ensure continuous improvement and swiftly resolve any data discrepancies. Additionally, you'll play a pivotal role in our Google Cloud migration journey, defining account data products to enhance our reporting and analytics capabilities in cloud. To your support you will work in close collaboration with the information architects and account product specialists to reach our desired state of defined account products, account data products and schemas.

The role reports to the Head of Data and Analytics within Cash Management. We are part of Corporate Banking, LC&FI and our tasks and responsibility often span across the SEB Group.

As a Data Steward and Account Data Specialist you will be responsible for:* Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with regulatory and internal standards.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to define data requirements and standards for account data products.
* Monitoring and report on data quality metrics and KPIs.
* Identifying and resolve data-related issues and discrepancies.
* Supporting reporting and data analytics initiatives to drive insights and business decisions.
* Continuously improve data management processes and tools.
* Collaborating with other data stewards, information architects, analysts, data owners, and our tech development teams.

 **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:*** Documented university degree or equivalent within areas such as finance, IT or engineering.
* A curious mindset and are a positive team player.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Deep understanding of data quality principles and best practices.
* An attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
* The ability to manage your time & prioritize.
* Account product knowledge.
* The ability to balance between reactive and strategic work.
* Track record in data management, data stewardship, or data governance within the banking sector.
* Data modelling knowledge, which is considered a bonus.

**What we offer:**
We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:* Work-life balance with the principle of office first.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Excellent office environment.
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* Deliver world-class service to customers.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 20th 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Elnäs, jonatan.elnas@seb.se.  

Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays. **Learn more about working at SEB:** www.sebgroup.com/career  

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Data & Analytics
description:
**Det här är Forefront:**  

Vi – Forefront – är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag som föddes 2008. Idag är vi över 550 medarbetare som strävar efter att få människa och teknik gå hand i hand, på över 10 kontor i Sverige och i USA.
  
  

Vi har som ambition att bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats. Det gör vi genom att uppskatta varandras olikheter, ständigt blicka framåt och skapa en organisation som är lika modig som klok.
  
Tillsammans är vi förenade av delade visioner och drivna av större ambitioner.
  
  

Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datahantering tillsammans med oss?
  
  

Vi strävar efter att sätta avtryck och skapa verklig förändring tillsammans med våra kunder. Det gör vi genom att bygga oslagbara team av drivna konsulter och genom att förstå kundens affärsproblem på djupet. Vår vision är att bli den ledande aktören inom Data & Analytics på den nordiska marknaden och vara det självklara valet för företag som står inför affärskritiska utmaningar kopplade till data. Vi är extra stolta över vårt partnerskap med Google Cloud, där vi blev utsedda till partner of the year tidigare i år. Vi är den enda svensktägda aktören på en Specialized Partner-nivå. Och vi är också stolta över våra starka samarbeten med Microsoft och Snowflake.
  
  

Vi söker just nu flera tillskott till vårt team och letar efter er som har haft dessa roller/titlar/ansvarsområden eller liknande:
  
  

Data Analyst
  
  

Data Engineer
  
  

Data Scientist
  
  

**I konsultrollen inom Data & Analytics kommer du:**  

Bli en del av Forefronts snabbast växande affärsområde och spela en viktig roll på vår fortsätta resa
  
  

Samarbeta med andra kollegor från Forefront, ofta i teamleveranser
  
  

Skapa och implementera framtidens plattformar och arbetssätt för datahantering
  
  

Hjälpa våra kunder att på ett hållbart sätt lyckas med sin data- och molntransformation
  
  

Arbeta i ett av Nordens största partnerskap med Google
  
  

Vidareutveckla vår affär och vår organisation
  
  

**För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har:**  

Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom Data & Analytics (t.ex. Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist) på någon av de stora publika molnplattformarna
  
  

Ingenjörsutbildning från högskola eller universitet
  
  

Programmeringsbakgrund med erfarenhet av SQL och Python eller likvärdigt
  
  

Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska (både i tal och skrift)
  
  

Vi tror också att du är kommunikativ, nyfiken och framåtlutad. Och har du ett intresse för att kombinera de senaste teknikerna med affärsnytta.
  
  

Innovationstakten och introduktionen av ny teknik går snabbare än någonsin och tekniken erbjuder otroligt mycket möjligheter. Som en del av vårat Data & Analytics team får du möjligheten att varje dag hjälpa kunder att frigöra dessa möjligheter.
  
  

Du får arbeta med olika tekniker, olika kunder och olika sorters problemställningar i en väldigt dynamisk miljö. Det bästa av allt? Du får göra det tillsammans med ett mångsidigt och passionerat team av likasinnade där vi stöttar varandra, utvecklas tillsammans och driver fram spännande lösningar.
  
  

**Utöver det erbjuder vi:**  

Stark gemenskap med många olika sociala nätverk och sammanhang. Exempelvis kör vi AW varje fredag, springer och spelar padel tillsammans. Vi firar framgångar på stora fester eller resor
  
Kompetensutveckling i form av bland annat certifieringar och utbildningar samt ett stort kontaktnät för erfarenhetsutbyte
  
Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete
  
STÖRRE ÄN SUMMAN
  
"Teknikälskare, designfantaster, människokännare och strateger. Vi behöver de som ser alla detaljer och de som målar med stora penseldrag. Det är i olikheterna vi lär oss av varandra."
  
ANDRAUTVECKLING
  
"Vad menar vi med "andrautveckling"? Jo, vi menar att det är en självklar del av självutvecklingen. Vi utvecklas och lär oss tillsammans, med våra kunder och våra partners."
  
FRAMÅT
  
"Att stå still är att stagnera. Det vill inte vi. Vi tar oss framåt – tillsammans. Här kan du utmana och utmanas oavsett var du befinner dig, eller vilken fas av livet du är i."
  
  

Sebastian Ljungberg | Kontaktperson
  
  

Skicka email 0762229900
  
Ansök nu

title: Virtual Partner Account Manager- Scandinavia
description:
**Extreme Networks Named to Computerworld’s 2023 List of Best Places to Work in IT!**

Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before and with double digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver better outcomes on scale, than Extreme.

We believe in “walking the walk” of our strong core values which enable us to successfully advance together. Diversity and Inclusion is a vital part of our values and beliefs, and we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive.

Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East. **THE ROLE – Manage Midsize and Small Partners**  

Has to develop relationships at various levels within assigned partners and further develop them and has to collaborate with the rest of the Sales team and technical delivery teams to bring our partners and customers the best solutions from across Extreme solutions and Services Portfolio
Has to guide new onboarded channels through our NOAR process, find new potential partners for growing regional strategy and develop relationships at various levels within them; has to align with the rest of sales team and technical delivery teams to bring our partners and customers the best solutions from across Extreme solutions and Services Portfolio
### **ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES**

* **Align channel strategy** with regional sales goals and sales team to increase revenue in assigned territory
* **Assigned partners** to prioritize tasks for growing strategy in assigned region. Track top performing partners for regional grow, build and align relation with them. Align business plan with regular (quarterly) review of goals and action plans. Ensure day-to-day visibility and timely response within their accounts and build relationship within partner's organization.
* **Acquisition of partners**; Working with regional teams to identify the gap in channel coverage; lead the onboarding process of new potential partners supported by another Extreme functional teams and local distribution
* **Evangelize the Proposition;** align partners with Extreme strategy and solutions; host regular updates, conference calls, events, activities for channel partners to review new Extreme Networks product or programs, updates, trainings concerns, marketing activities and any concerns that need to be addressed supported by sales and technical resources
* **Closing sales** together with sales team in assigned opportunities; mapping partners against opportunities, tracking longtail pipeline together with distributors and distribution team, handling forecast for assigned tracking criteria
* **Guidance** as primary internal Extreme contact person with another Extreme teams regarding escalations and issues, RMAs, services, sales tool development, trainings, order operations, etc.
* **Partner program ambassador**; utilize available programs and initiatives, organize regular updates for channels in assigned territory together with partner program team
* **Ensure partners compliancy** and enablement regarding partner program
* **Develop sales pipeline and channel capability** using available Extreme development funds; execute marketing plans together with regional marketing manager to promote Extreme Network and regional goals
* **Coordinate and track** all major channel activities in assigned territory
* **Regional channel librarian** – day-to-day resource for partner communication and updates, assign their request to proper Extreme resources
* **Distribution alliance** together with distribution team to support channels via aligned distribution strategy in assigned region
* **Drive our rules of Engagement** with Channel Partners’ to/from, Inside Sales, Account executives, System engineers and others as appropriate internally and within the partner.

### **CORE SKILLS**

* Ability to grade and identify partners with the highest potential to growth
* Capability to drive the partner’s journey towards the Autonomous Partner
* Ability to build a trusted and strong relation with the top performing partners and distributors
* Organize QBR’s and align business plans with the top performing partners
* Managing expectations between partners, sales team and Distribution
* Strong presentation skills in positioning Extreme’s value propositions.
* Leverage internal tools ( Clari, SFDC, Tableau..) to analyze data and track consistency with the plan
* Channel Forecasting ( pag.5, chapter 7)
* Partner enablement and “Welcome New Partners” webinars
* Re-Engagement process on the defined Dormant partner in your region

### **METRICS**

* **Assigned Partners performance:** Revenue achievement as per Partner AOP
* **Assigned Partners total pipeline growth**
* **Marketing excellence:** MDF Usage, Pipeline creation, Nurturing and reporting
* **Training and enablement:** Certification
* **Autonomous Partner:** DR level, Quote from partners (Iris), Channel Self-Service tool usage
* **Personal development:** Dojo points / Belt achievement
* **Numbers of IgniteTech / IgniteSales:** Technical and Sales people from partners joining & following to Ignite community


#LI-Remote

title: Key Account Manager
description:
**Want to Join** Frends Growth Journey?


Frends is growing and we are strengthening our Frends Sweden team. As a result, we´re looking for a new **Key Account Manager**.


Frends eiPaaS is our own modern, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers and in both private and public sectors in various industries. Frends is recognized in the latest Gartner Magic Quadrant for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends was also awarded in G2 review with the "Fastest Implementation", "High Performer" and "Easiest Admin" badges in 2022 and 2023. Our customers give us 4.7 out of 5 stars on Gartner Peer Insights.


In this role, you are responsible for designated customers and growing and developing their solutions to the next level. You work closely with internal stakeholders, such as service and project managers, Frends delivery teams, sales, and management, in order to discover and deliver the best solutions for our customers.


**The role includes**


* customer management
* handling all customer and internal communication and cooperation
* responsible for customer revenue and profitability
* upselling and offering new services to customers
* delivery leadership
* leading the customer delivery together with the Frends Delivery organization
* participating in the projects and services steering meetings according to Frends account management model

**We guarantee**


* low hierarchy and flexible **and relaxed organizational** culture. Strong team spirit, as well as **trust, freedom, and flexibility,** are the cornerstones of our culture
* strong, **growing market, and strong investments** in both our people and product
* the opportunity to work in one of the Nordics' leading and growing integration technology organization and **influence our growth journey**
* an interesting and **responsible role** where you can further **develop your skills and career**
* own, Finnish integration platform **Frends** which is recognized in the latest **Gartner** **Magi**c Quadrant for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide.
* **flexible working times and hybrid work mode in Sweden**
* skilled and supporting co-workers and **supervisor**
* an employer who **supports you in various life situations**
* **safe, stable, modern**, and growing workplace
* competitive salary

**We expect**


* understanding of integration technology, familiarity with SaaS or PaaS solutions
* +3-5 years relevant experience in account management role in the IT sector
* curiosity toward technical solutions
* strong communication skills and business-centric thinking
* ability and willingness to work in fast-paced situations and growing company
* as a person: active, strong communication skills, goal-oriented, committed and responsible, enjoying the low hierarchy culture, and most importantly have an enthusiastic attitude which itself will raise our good team spirit
* fluent in English and Swedish and living in Sweden (visiting our Stockholm office is required on weekly bases)

**Interested in joining us?**


If you want to impact and join our growth journey, please contact us and let us know more about you!


We will start going through the applications in the beginning of August


**Other related to the job**


* The start is flexible according to your situation.
* The position will be filled as soon as the right person is found.
* The salary will be a fixed monthly salary plus a bonus model.
* You will be reporting to Fredrik Wingren, Regional Director, Sweden.
* The role requires fluent Swedish and excellent English and living in Sweden. We support hybrid work mode but also require visiting our Stockholm office on a weekly basis.

**Want** to know more about Frends?


**Frends** eiPaaS is our own, Nordic, modern, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller **customers** and in both private and public sectors in various industries. As a brand Frends is over 30 years old but the recent rise of iPaaS Frends has seen explosive growth in the Nordic and Europe markets. It has been and is constantly being developed by our own R&D team. The latest incarnation of the product utilizes modern technologies and cloud services.


**Frends** is recognized in the **Gartner** **Magic Quadrant** for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends was also awarded in **G2 review** with the "Fastest Implementation" badge in 2023.


Visit our **we**bpage. Check out our **use cases**. Listen to our **webi**nars. Learn more about Frendszone from our **blogs**.

title: Safety Training Engineer
description:
The ESS is at an exciting turning point. It is in transition from being a construction site, to being an operating facility. To help us realise our goal of being the most powerful neutron source in the world, we are now seeking to appoint a Safety Training Engineer to join our Environment, Safety, Health (ESH) & Security division. The ESH & Security division at ESS is responsible for developing, supporting, monitoring and assuring the implementation of policies, rules, processes, objectives and best practices at all levels of the organisation in matters of ESH & Security.



Our division develops and maintains a strategy for Environment, Safety, Health & Security - in particular the regulatory compliance strategy - developing an ESS safety and security culture. This includes the continual improvement of related programs and activities, as well as the coordination of mandatory authority contacts in these matters.



In the role as Safety Training Engineer you will be responsible for safety training at ESS aligning safety training with our strategic objectives and ensuring successful integration of safety training across the organisation. You will have the mandate to lead development and implementation of safety trainings and safety training programs across ESS. You will manage the Learning Management System (LMS), enhance its support for safety training initiatives and user experience, and use your knowledge of to develop and deliver engaging, impactful and relevant training to a diverse audience of engineers, technicians, scientists and other related professionals.



You will leverage your expertise to advise on ways of working, to manage and develop safety training and to communicate to the organisation on new or updated safety trainings. You will also be required to liaise with the Training Coordinator and HR to facilitate training sessions, ensuring strategic content delivery within the LMS, implement quality assurance measures to evaluate training effectiveness and facilitate continuous improvement and maintain current and accessible documentation for the Safety Training function.



This is a full-time, permanent position with a 6 months´ probationary period based at the ESS Campus in Lund, Sweden.


**About you:**



For this role, we need someone with at least 5-10 years experiences in a similar or related position who holds a Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a relevant qualification in Occupational Health and Safety. Your expertise extends to Learning Management Systems, including platforms like Saba Cloud and Cornerstone. You're someone who is adept at hands-on e-learning development; from needs assessment and gap analysis to course development, training implementation, and evaluation. Proficiency with e-learning authoring tools, such as Articulate, would give you a unique advantage.



As an experienced safety training engineer or expert, your approach to continuous improvement is relentless. You excel at developing and delivering digital training content, drawing on a deep understanding of learning processes and training cycles. Your skills in competence development should be matched by your ability to manage diverse stakeholders effectively and lead projects to successful completion. We need someone who does not shy away from challenges.. We need someone who has the proven ability to set and maintain the highest standards of quality and productivity. Your systematic and methodical approach ensures you consistently achieve goals. Flexibility is another of your strengths, as you will need to adapt readily to changing circumstances and new ideas, demonstrating respect and sensitivity to suit different people or situations.



We are building ESS from the ground up, so we need someone who is comfortable not only following procedures, but also creating them. We attach great importance to personality and attitude, so we're looking for a real team player: Someone who has a natural ability to work with people, demonstrating empathy, adaptability, and a knack for building team spirit. Your communication skills are exemplary; you speak clearly and confidently, express ideas effectively, and engage audiences with ease.



The working language of ESS is English but the ability to also work in Swedish would be an advantage. For this role, we need someone who can start as soon as possible.


**What can we offer?**



Aside from the chance to work at truly unique big science project, you can also expect:


* An opportunity to contribute to the future discoveries within neutron science.
* A stunning, brand new workplace filled with innovative minds and brilliant people from across the globe.
* A challenging, innovative and stimulating work environment.
* Market competitive compensation that is individual and differentiated according to role, responsibilities, individual skills, abilities and achievements.
* 30 days of annual leave, as well as more than 10 days of public holiday and company days off or days with limited working hours.
* Monthly pension contributions on top of your salary.


If you see yourself in what we’re looking for, please provide your CV and motivation letter in English . Please be aware that we can only accept direct applications made via the ESS website.



Certain roles at ESS require health and safety checks and/or security clearance procedures, which will be performed as part of the recruitment process.



The last day for receiving application is the **11th of August 2024** - so submit your application as soon as soon as you can. Please quote the job reference number ESD-47364 in your application.



For more information regarding the ESS recruitment process, please contact Daniel Nordin Baker – Recruitment partner – at daniel.nordin@ess.eu. For further information regarding the position, please contact the hiring manager, Helen Boyer, via helen.boyer@ess.eu



For trade union information, please contact Unionen representative Mikael Johansson on Mikael.Johansson@ess.eu or SACO/Swedish Association of Graduate Engineers representative Marc Kickulies at marc.kickulies@ess.eu


*We look forward to receiving your application soon!*

title: Operation Engineer Talent Program
description:
Meet a Student är en jobbplattform för juniora talanger.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
  

Are you passionate about cloud technology and infrastructure? Do you have a knack for troubleshooting and a desire to help customers optimize their Cloud and Kubernetes environments? If so, Redeploy Run has the perfect opportunity for you who are looking to kick-start your career!
  
  

✍ About the Operation Engineer Talent Program
  
  

Our Operation Engineer Talent Program is designed to give you hands-on experience and in-depth knowledge of Cloud and Kubernetes environments. You will work alongside experienced professionals, learning the ins and outs of maintaining and optimizing cloud and Kubernetes platforms.
  
  

**In this role you will get the opportunity to learn how to:**  

Proactively maintain and optimize Cloud and Kubernetes platforms
  
  

Troubleshoot live issues
  
  

Support customers in modernizing and improving their environments
  
  

What you will gain
  
  

Possibility of a permanent position after completing the program
  
  

Receive training and mentorship from experienced professionals
  
  

Practical experience in managing and optimizing cloud and Kubernetes environments
  
  

Be a part of the Redeploy team and culture. A friendly, humble and driven atmosphere
  
  

Who are you?
  
  

Enrolling in their LIA internship this fall, or recently completed a relevant educational program (such as ICT Engineer, Cloud and Infrastructure Specialist or similar)
  
  

A person with a strong interest in cloud technology and infrastructure. It´s a plus if you already have some hands-on experience
  
  

A person with strong problem-solving skills, able to tackle complex issues effectively and who is curious, humble and eager to learn and take responsibility for your own development.
  
  

Location
  
  

We have offices located in central Stockholm and Jönköping. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to either of our office locations.
  
  

Ready to apply?
  
  

We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
  
  

We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson – Francisca.andersson@redeploy.com
  
  

We look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

About Redeploy Run
  
  

At Redeploy Run, we specialize in platform engineering and operations, helping our customers simplify their infrastructure and speed up application delivery. Our mission is to make cloud adoption faster and easier.
  
  

Our 'Ready-to-Run' platform products, including Technology Platforms and Industry Cloud Platforms, let IT departments and developers manage infrastructure and governance with ease. Leveraging Infrastructure as Code, container-based services, CI/CD, and Kubernetes, and collaborating with cloud providers like Azure and AWS, we tackle complex problems, enhance our tools, and provide guidance to help customers get the most out of their cloud platforms.

title: AI Engineer - Apply by July 17
description:
**Grow with us**



Impactpool has established itself as a global leader in connecting talent with impact organizations dedicated to making a meaningful difference in the world. Close to 1 million top talent from 195 countries have already decided to join the platform and we proudly serve over 2,500 organizations, helping them find suitable candidates to further their missions. Last year alone, we matched 1.5 million candidates to jobs where they will contribute to a positive impact.



As an AI engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing machine learning models and AI solutions to solve complex problems and drive innovation within our organization.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Model Development:** Design, build, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms to address business challenges. Utilize supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning, and Generative AI techniques as appropriate.


**AI Integration:** Take part in development to integrate AI solutions into the application.


**LLM Integration:** Utilize large language models (LLMs) to enhance natural language processing capabilities in our applications.


**Data Processing:** Gather, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to support model training and evaluation. Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.


**Algorithm Optimization:** Optimize and tune models for performance, scalability, and accuracy. Conduct experiments and perform hyperparameter tuning to improve model effectiveness.


**Integration:** Work closely with software engineers to integrate machine learning models into production systems. Ensure seamless deployment and maintenance of AI/ML solutions.


**Research and Innovation:** Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML technologies and research. Apply new methodologies and tools, including Generative AI and LLMs, to enhance our AI capabilities.


**Monitoring and Maintenance:** Monitor the performance of deployed models and maintain them to ensure they continue to deliver accurate and reliable results. Implement feedback loops and retraining mechanisms as necessary.


**Collaboration:** Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements, define project goals, and deliver AI-driven solutions that meet business needs.


**Documentation:** Document the development process, model architecture, and performance metrics. Ensure clear and comprehensive documentation for future reference and knowledge sharing.

  



Qualifications:


**Education:** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.

  


**This is the experience we believe you have:**


* Proven experience as an AI/ML Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, SpacY).
* Experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization.
* Hands-on experience with Generative AI and large language models (LLMs).

**We would like to see that you have the following skills:**


* Experience with prompt design
* Strong understanding on LLM training strategies
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and Ruby.
* Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) for deploying AI/ML solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and innovation.

**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience with natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or other specialized AI domains.
* Knowledge of deep learning techniques and neural network architectures.
* Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for model deployment and lifecycle management.
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows.
* Experience working on Ruby on Rails applications

We're looking for a generalist with a strong track record of working with different AI and ML techniques. Preferably someone that's been implementing production solutions using custom trained models and LLMs. Someone who can take responsibility and ownership and who can manage themself. Someone who can understand what actions need to be taken to reach the goal. And knows when to overachieve and when good enough is good enough, who understands that the customers are crucial for the company's existence.



Having a Computer Science degree is great but not something that we care too much about. What's important is that you have the right drive and the skills needed to do the job and that you are eager to continue learning.



Being a distributed team, it's essential that you can communicate concisely and effectively in writing using English.

  



This is a remote position, but we prefer candidates close to the Central European time zone.

  



What we offer



At Impactpool, we pride ourselves on creating an enriching work environment that fosters both personal and professional growth. Here’s what you can expect when you join our team:


* Remote/Hybrid Working Model: Enjoy the flexibility of working either remotely or hybrid from our HQ in Stockholm, Södermalm.
* Competitive Salary and Benefits Package: We offer a salary that reflects your skills, experience, and contribution to our mission. Benefits include healthcare and other essential benefits to support your well-being.
* Collaborative and Innovative Work Culture: Immerse yourself in an international and inclusive atmosphere where collaboration and innovation are at the heart of everything we do.
* Opportunities for Growth and Professional Development: We provide diverse career paths, mentorship, training programs, and exposure to various projects to help you reach your full potential.
* Annual Staff Retreat: Participate in our annual staff retreat, where the entire company gathers to collaborate, build connections, and create lasting memories. It's a perfect blend of teamwork and relaxation, designed to strengthen our community and inspire collective success.

At Impactpool, we believe that each team member's uniqueness, skills, and experiences are essential to our innovation and growth. We are a diverse team and even though we're spread out across the world, we’re united by our joint mission and willingness to succeed together.



We are looking forward to your application! Kindly submit your application on July 17th at the latest.


  
Impactpool

Kokopäiväinen

title: Head of Cloud Services, IST Group
description:
Are you ready to lead Cloud operations for the leading Scandinavian Edtech company in its transformation into a global Edtech solution provider?
  
IST Group is looking for a Head of Cloud Services to spearhead this exciting journey.
  
About IST Group
  
IST Group is a renowned Scandinavian Edtech company that is dedicated to transforming education into a global Edtech solution. In the ever-changing world of education technology we are leading the way. Every day, IST's solutions make a difference for millions of people around the world.
  
Our commitment to innovation and excellence has led to the establishment of IST Cloud, an international department responsible for delivering a private cloud platform for IST's international solutions. We provide cutting-edge cloud computing services designed to empower IST's departments to focus on developing value for users without worrying about underlying infrastructure or hardware resources.
  
About the Role
  
As the Head of Cloud Services at IST Group, you will play a pivotal role in managing both the Corporate IT and IST private cloud operations. IST Cloud serves as the backbone for our international solutions, with employees in Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Germany.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Lead and manage IST Cloud and Corporate IT teams, consisting of 16 skilled employees across Corporate IT, Operations SE/NO, Infrastructure and Platform.
  
Oversee the development and maintenance of IST's private cloud platform.
  
Drive innovation and optimization in cloud services, ensuring we meet the needs of IST's international userbase.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align cloud services with the company's strategic goals.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Proven experience in managing larger IT infrastructures and IT operations.
  
Strong understanding of Infrastructure as a Service (IAAS) and Platform as a Service (PAAS).
  
Familiarity with cloud technologies such as VMware, Rancher Docker/Kubernetes, Cisco, Linux, Active Directory, PostgreSQL, and Oracle.
  
Proficiency in Windows, Mac, Active Directory, Office 365, Cisco, and Atlassian suite.
  
Excellent leadership and team management skills.
  
Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  
  

Why IST Group
  
Join a dynamic and visionary company at the forefront of Edtech transformation.Lead a team of professionals in a supportive and collaborative work environment.When it comes to education, we believe that only the best is good enough. Contribute to the growth of a platform serving over 5,000,000 users, 10,000 preschools and schools, and 400 municipalities.Work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and shape the future of Edtech.If you are a passionate and experienced cloud services leader ready to drive innovation in an ambitious Edtech company, we want to hear from you. Be part of our journey as we redefine education on a global scale.
  
Location
  
We are looking for the best candidate, but preferred that the candidate will have base at IST HQ in Växjö, Sweden. Alternatively Roskilde, Denmark or Oslo, Norway – in this case travel must be excepted.
  
Application
  
To apply the job in TeamTailor, please send your resume and a cover letter including relevant experience and how you can contribute to ISTs success in this role. Welcome to submit your application in Swedish or English, no later than 2024-08-11. Screening of candidates will beongoing, and interviews may start before the application deadline, so please apply already today.
  
If you have any questions realted to the roleplease contact Mikael Folkesson, mikael.folkesson@ist.com,or for general questions around the recruitment contact HR@ist.com.
  
Background checks will occur in the recruitment process.
  
Welcome to apply to IST Group to be a part of transforming education for a brighter future. Let's empower learning – together.

title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Finanskonsult
description:
För att bibehålla sin konkurrenskraft behöver våra SAP kunder förflytta sig mot den nya tidens affärsmodeller och IT-landskap.


Som konsult på Stretch kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder med att skapa användarcentrerade digitala resor med stöd av agila leveransmetoder, molnteknologier och automatiserade processer.


Finans är hjärtat i ett ERP system och vi söker dig med gedigen kunskap inom finansområdet, gärna med verksamhetserfarenhet av ekonomiprocesserna.


Vi ser helst att du har har jobbat med SAP och konfigurerat finansprocesser hos olika typer av kunder. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med S/4 HANA.

**Det här hjälper dig att lyckas i din roll:**

* Våra kollegor och kultur - vi hjälper varandra över alla bolagsgränser. Du är aldrig ensam och kan när som helst sträcka ut en hand och få hjälp.
* Vårt befintliga starka processteam inom SAP med tillgång till en egenutvecklad S/4 miljö.
* Sveriges bästa nätverk inom S/4 HANA internt och externt.

**Vi tror att:**

  

* Du är nyfiken på att lära dig nytt, samtidigt är du inte rädd för att kliva fram och ge tydliga rekommendationer.
* Du är van att arbeta självständigt samt leda arbete i grupp.
* Du är proffsig, ödmjuk och serviceorienterad.

Så här säger våra medarbetare:

  

Vi på Stretch har en stark teamkänsla och kompetensmångfald med en stor blandning av både seniora och juniora kollegor. Vi tillhör ett bolag där vi har möjligheter att påverka och utvecklas.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


Hälsar teamet på Stretch Evolve i Göteborg


PS. Vi söker också kollegor till vårt starka SAP-team i Stockholm!
company_description: Stretch gör skillnad genom att ha affärsvärde i fokus, leveransförmåga i toppklass och entreprenörskap i vårt DNA. Dessutom har vi riktigt roligt när vi jobbar tillsammans. Följ med oss!

title: Network Architect

title: Junior Associate - McKinsey Digital
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You will be based in our Stockholm office as part of our McKinsey Digital practice.
   

  

 McKinsey Digital brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and digital strategy to agile, cloud and digital business building.
   

  

 You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.
   

  

 When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You’ll work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement.
   

  

 This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.
   

  

 You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on your teams. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as more formal training in your first few years. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
* Outstanding records of academic and managerial or professional achievement
* Strong record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting
* Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
* Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing
* Fluency in English; fluency in the local language is a plus
* Willingness to travel

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you have a curious and analytical mindset and get inspired from being part of building a new world class cyber security organization? Then H&M Group can offer you a position that matches your personality! We are looking for Cyber Security Architect to join our organization based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Contextualize corporate strategic vision, conducting analysis, identifying opportunities, and defining strategic activities in the Cyber Security domain.
* Analyze, design, develop, and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans to enable future-state security capabilities, ensuring organizational resilience, stability, and operational excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement and simplification to enhance end-to-end business value, collaborating across the organization to lower the total cost of ownership.
* Develop control mechanisms to manage Cyber risks in alignment with business risk appetite.


**Architecture Enablement** 
 :
   

  

* Develop conceptual and logical architecture designs, creating artifacts such as security principles, guardrails, capability models, and future state blueprints.
* Facilitate the delivery of targeted business outcomes, including drafting and proposing Architecture Decision Records, anchoring and ratifying Architecture Decisions, and monitoring their adoption and effectiveness.
* Maintain a registry of security solutions relevant to the domain, ensuring security capability maturity and managing the lifecycle of Architecture Decision Records.


**Change Enablement** 
 :
   

  

* Identify interdependencies and employ holistic thinking to design and implement solutions, considering cross-team perspectives.
* Act as a facilitator for complex technical topics, collaborating across functions to ensure comprehensive consultation.
* Communicate security best practices to embed security into platforms and products, sharing knowledge with the engineering and delivery community.


**Qualifications**
 What you need to succeed:
   

  

* Mastery of multiple security areas with deeper expertise in one or more of the following: Device security, Application security, Data security, Cloud security, Network security, Secure development, and IAM.
* Demonstrated skills and experience in information security within an international and diverse context.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within a non-hierarchical culture of


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What we offer!**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm

title: IT Technician
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play, and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.
   

  

**The role**
 Our team is growing and we are currently looking for an IT Technician to strengthen our global Internal IT team.
   

  

 As an IT Technician, you report to the IT Manager for the Workplace and Hardware domain in Europe and will collaborate closely with fellow team members. As an IT Technician you will be the face of IT and your core duties will expect you to work independently in an IT support capacity; owning, participating, and handling incoming IT tickets.
   

  

 You will also help end-users with troubleshooting in person, via video and chat messages and support using remote access tooling.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced international company, with a great team that loves problem-solving and finding the best solutions possible.
   

  

 We are working with a cloud-first strategy, so you will be working with top-of-the-line technology and minimal on-premise infrastructure.
   

  

**You will contribute & make an impact by**
* Helping your colleagues with various IT-related issues, as well as monitoring and following up on reported Incidents and Service Requests
* On-site support at our Stockholm Office and remote support to other offices
* Managing hardware procurement and fulfillment
* Working with our Joiner, Mover, and Leaver process
* Keeping documentation, knowledge base articles, and CMDB up-to-date
* Plan and lead internal educational sessions across all functional areas
* Participating in exciting IT and Business projects


**About You**
 We don’t know you yet but we believe that you are:
   

  

**Self-motivated** 
 - The ability to work effectively, both independently and as part of a team
   

  

**Proactive** 
 - Self-driving, taking responsibility, and delivering on promises
   

  

**Team player** 
 - Likes to work in a team environment and willing to help other team members
   

  

**Curious** 
 - Desire to learn more and excited about new technologies and tools
   

  

**Geek/Gamer** 
 - The real purpose of a computer!
   

  

**Your background**
 We don’t think one size fits all, but a successful candidate might have the following:
   

  

* Recently graduated from a relevant school/program, or has worked for a couple of years in the field and knows how to work in a structured and organized way in an IT environment
* Experience giving remote and on-site end-user support
* Experience in Troubleshooting on both PC and Apple computers
* Experience in administration
* It's a plus if you have experience with: a ticketing system, Google Workspace, account administration, Atlassian products, and fixing your computer after breaking it yourself
* Good spoken and written skills in English are required. Swedish is not required but is a plus


 This role is based at our headquarters in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 . The position will require occasional support after business hours and travel to offices within Sweden and other countries.
   

  

**Life at EasyPark**
 We are a values-driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiative and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embrace change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Pension, insurance & health reimbursement: A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurance
* Proactive health support: your well-being is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your needs.
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call
* Wellness reimbursement: 5000 SEK/year

title: Cloud Service Manager
description:
*Saab is a place where teamwork makes things fly. Literally. Join us and experience our supportive and friendly workplace.*
 Your role
   

  

 As Service Manager, you will work close together with Cloud Center of Excellence and Cloud Engineers to lead the journey towards established Cloud Services in operations. We are expanding within the newly established delivery unit, Digital Accelerator, and are looking for an experienced Service Manager. You will lead the service delivery and drive change in our new Service Area, Cloud Foundation.
   

  

 This critical role will be responsible for establishing and managing our use of public cloud services, with a primary focus on Azure for landing zones and selected SaaS services. In this position you will play a key role in building and growing this new service area.
   

  

**The main tasks include:**
* Establish and lead the service delivery to support our organisation's use of public cloud services
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize cloud initiatives that align with business objectives
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and efficiency of the service area
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, best practices, and internal policies related to cloud services
* Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to the service area team and foster a business oriented and forward leaning mindset
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and innovations in cloud technologies and services


 Domestic travels can occur frequently since the organisation is located on different sites. International travel may also be needed at times.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We believe that you are passionate about cloud technologies and have the drive to establish and grow a critical service area within our organisation. You are as comfortable working under your own initiative as you are working as part of a team. This is an excellent opportunity to make a significant impact and advance your career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
   

  

 As a person, you are a driven communicator (verbally and written), especially in the collaboration with internal stakeholders and have the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation in Swedish and English.
   

  

 Required Skills:
   

  

* Academic degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent
* Experience in managing cloud services, preferably with Azure
* Understanding of cloud architectures, including landing zones
* Familiarity with cloud security, compliance, and governance frameworks
* Knowledge of IT service management frameworks such as ITIL
* Project management skills with the ability to prioritize and execute multiple initiatives simultaneously
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills


 Desired Skills:
   

  

* Interest or experience in Change Management, preferably cloud transformation projects
* Experience in agile ways of working
* Knowledge in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and DevOps practices
* Proven track record of successfully being part of implementing and managing large-scale cloud initiatives


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Kindly observe that the selection for this recruitment process will begin in August. However, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible!

title: IT Support inom Mac & Windows
description:
*Nu söker vi en IT Supporttekniker med erfarenhet av att supportera både inom Windows- och Mac miljö och vill fortsätta utvecklas i en kombinerad IT-miljö. Vill du vara en del av en varm företagskultur som värnar om din framtid? Då kan du vara den vi söker!*
 Du kommer att hantera ärenden via telefon, mejl, ärendehanteringssystem men även på plats där användarna kan komma förbi dig och dina kollegor. Arbetsdagarna kommer att vara varierande med ärenden av olika karaktär men oavsett brinner du för mötet med användarna och att hjälpa dem i sin vardag.
   

  

**För den här rollen** 
 ser vi att du har erfarenhet av att stödja
 **m** 
**acOS** 
 och
 **Windows** 
 -baserade system samt älskar att ge personlig och kundfokuserad support.
   

  

**Du har bland annat arbetslivserfarenhet av:**
* Mac OS och Windows OS
* Microsoft 365
* Jamf/Intune
* Google Workspace
* Active Directory/Azure AD
* Konferensutrustning och skrivare
* ServiceNow eller annat ärendehanteringssystem
* Du kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


**Som person** 
 är du lyhörd och duktig på att identifiera vad användaren har för behov och har förmågan att prioritera bland dina arbetsuppgifter utefter situation. Du är social och tycker om att möta nya människor samt är pedagogisk i ditt tillvägagångssätt. Vidare brinner du för IT och är uppmärksam på nya trender inom branschen och har ett intresse för hålla dig uppdaterad inom teknikens värld.
   

  

**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  

**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
   

  

 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   

  

*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Client Success Manager
description:
*Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately three million users around the world 🌍 We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included "Because People Matter" 💙.*
**Client Success Manager**
 As a Client Success Manager, your primary responsibility will be to support our customers in utilizing our platform to maximize value and ensure customer satisfaction.
   

  

 Working alongside our Account Managers, you will nurture and sustain our long-term customer relationships. You will be responsible for driving improvements within the customer segment, owning the processes independently. These tasks are mainly technical, requiring a proactive mindset to maintain and enhance customer value. The role involves handling a wide range of cases varying in scope and complexity. You'll act as the pivotal point of contact, with a strong focus on problem-solving, ensuring cases are resolved promptly and customers receive quick feedback.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Operate within our systems to manage deliveries.
* Build and maintain daily communication with both customers and internal colleagues.
* Adapt the Benify platform to meet customer-specific needs proactively to increase value for the customer.


**What Benify Offers You**
 At Benify, you'll have the opportunity to work in an organization where everyone contributes to our success, supports each other, and enjoys the journey. We recognize that our people are the key to our success, and we welcome and encourage your ideas. Your development within the organization is driven by your initiatives, personal goals, and curiosity. At Benify, we work with great passion and succeed together! As a Benify employee, you'll enjoy:
   

  

* Collective agreement 📝
* ITP1 Pension & Lifeplan – a pension tool offering personalized advice to optimize your savings 📈
* 30 vacation days 🌞
* SEK 4,000 wellness allowance ♂️ 🏃
* Workation – the opportunity to work abroad within the EU 🌍
* Annual international conference & numerous social events & activities at our offices ✌️


**Who are you?**
 As a Client Success Manager, you will act as the central point of contact, tackling challenges with a solution-oriented approach. You will independently identify solutions to customer problems, regardless of complexity. You have an eye for detail and enjoy taking ownership of customer relationships, organizing your work autonomously. You will coordinate resources to meet deadlines and ensure cases are resolved promptly. Strong collaboration skills are essential, as the role involves extensive interaction. You see opportunities in change, are keen on establishing new solutions, and are constantly seeking ways to build trust with customers and internal departments.
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone Who Has**
* One or more years of experience in a similar role, working in a coordinating, business-oriented manner with ongoing customer contact.
* A strong interest in technical solutions and problem-solving, as the role is primarily technical, involving complex and simple cases.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**It Is Also Advantageous If You**
* Have previous experience with a SaaS company.
* Proficiency in Danish, both spoken and written.
* Hold a university degree in economics, business, administration, or a related field.
* Have experience working with systems such as JIRA and/or Salesforce.


**Practical Information**
* Start: As soon as we find our perfect match 🧐
* Scope: Full-time, 100%.
* Location: Apelbergsgatan 33A, Stockholm. We offer great flexibility for hybrid work, with approximately 3 days/week in the office.


 📢 Interested in the role of Client Success Manager? Apply by submitting your CV or LinkedIn profile in
 **English** 
 . The selection process is ongoing and may close before the application deadline, so apply as soon as possible!
   

  

 Benify started in 2004 in Sweden with a goal to revolutionize the HR industry with a platform that would improve the lives of employees. Today, Benify is an independent, flexible, and agile global HR technology company, offering the market’s leading global benefits and total rewards platform.

title: Process- and System Specialist
description:
Nu rekryterar vi en Process- och Systemspecialist till Munters, som är ett av Sveriges största industribolag. I denna spännande roll blir du en nyckelperson i att automatisera och digitalisera finansiella processer inom Shared Service Center för den nordiska verksamheten. Du kommer att ansvara för den lokala datan i ERP-systemet, IFS, aktivt arbeta med effektiviseringsarbete och säkerställa hög kvalitet i samtliga processer för redovisning och controlling.
 



  





 Du ingår i ett team om 15 personer och rapporterar till Head of Finance för Shared Service Center Nordics. Kontoret är beläget i Kista med möjlighet till distansarbete.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Arbeta med processförbättringar inom Finance
* Driva och deltaga i aktiviteter och projekt både inom och utanför avdelningen, t.ex. samarbete med IT
* Förvalta och ansvara för den lokala datan i IFS Cloud
* Starta upp effektiviseringsarbete med hjälp av RPA/AI och på sikt utveckla det
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet och effektivitet i enlighet med Munters policys och gällande lagar och regler
* Omvärldsbevakning för att upprätthålla moderna arbetssätt för Shared Service Center



  





**Din bakgrund** 



* Akademisk examen inom ekonomi/redovisning
* Erfarenhet av kvalificerat redovisningsarbete inom ett shared service center
* Tidigare erfarenhet i en liknande roll och att genomföra processförbättringar och effektiviseringsarbete, med fördel erfarenhet av RPA/AI
* Goda kunskaper i Excel och större ekonomisystem
* Skriver och talar obehindrat i både svenska och engelska
* Det är meriterande med tidigare erfarenhet av IFS Cloud och AARO



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du som person har en god kommunikativ förmåga och har lätt för att samarbeta med flera intressenter. Du räds inte för att ta initiativ och driva förändringsarbete eller parallella projekt. Vidare bidrar du med positiv energi till gruppen och är noggrann i ditt arbete.
 



  





**Om Munters** 




 Munters är en global ledare inom energieffektiva och hållbara klimatlösningar. Vi erbjuder innovativa, effektiva och hållbara lösningar till kunder inom många olika kundsegment, där kontroll av luftfuktighet, temperatur och energieffektivitet inomhus är verksamhetskritiskt.
 



  





 Hållbarhet är en viktig del av vår affärsstrategi och värdeskapande.
 



  





 Vi är ett ambitiöst och flexibelt bolag, och värdesätter en arbetsmiljö där medarbetarna får friheten att experimentera och lösa problem utan pretentioner.
 



  





 Genom att främja en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid ökar vi både motivation och produktivitet.
 



  





 På Munters arbetar vi globalt med att stödja våra kunders verksamhetskritiska processer inom olika branscher, såsom elbilsbatterier, medicin, vindkraftverk och jordbruk. Hos oss bidrar du till att lösa världens stora utmaningar och gör en verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Om Agigo** 




 Agigo är ett konsult- och rekryteringsföretag inom ekonomi & finans i Stockholmsområdet. Genom ett modernt och beprövat arbetssätt skapar vi en enkel, smidig och transparent process.
 



  





 Vi matchar dagligen kandidater med spännande bolag. Vår ambition är att agera din karriärspartner genom arbetslivet. Med kontinuerlig kontakt och högt engagemang sätter vi dig i fokus.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter det intressant? Ansök redan nu. Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare; Rebecca Benholm på; rebecca.benholm@agigo.se eller 076-000 63 80.

title: Senior Digital Transformation Consultant
description:
Are you a passionate digital leader looking to help some of the largest companies in the Nordics and drive their Digital transformation? This role is for you! As a Senior Digital Transformation Consultant, you'll be part of leading the charge in using technology to modernize Wavemaker's clients and deliver exceptional service.
   

  

**You'll Be Responsible For:**
 Strategy and Planning:
   

  

* Assessing Wavemaker's clients current digital maturity and drive processes to drive clients maturity forward.
* Developing comprehensive digital strategies that aligns with the overall business goals of our clients.
* Staying updated on the latest digital trends and technologies to see what can benefit the company and their clients.


 Leadership and Implementation:
   

  

* Overseeing the implementation of the digital transformation journey for our clients, which may involve various departments and projects.
* Convincing and guiding our clients’ management teams on the importance of digital transformation initiatives.
* Managing digital transformation projects for our clients with the assistance of internal specialists from across the GroupM agencies.


 Communication and Change Management:
   

  

* Encouraging a company culture that embraces digital transformation.
* Communicating the vision and benefits of digital transformation to all staff levels.


**You'll Be Measured By:**
 Execution & Delivery:
   

  

* Oversee the implementation of digital solutions and platforms for our clients and ensure that all projects track progress, measure results, and identify areas for improvement.
* Project Excellence: Delivering digitization projects that meet deadlines, quality standards, and cost targets.
* Technology Adoption: Driving the adoption of digital technologies to achieve objectives.


**You Are:**
* A self-starter who has a proven track record in leading digital transformation projects.
* A strong leader with a positive, organized, and results-oriented approach.
* Someone who is accustomed to working both at a strategic and a hands-on level with data to deliver business value.
* Adept at working with and influencing stakeholders at all levels, both internally and externally.
* Skilled in commercial negotiations and managing third-party suppliers effectively.
* A proven leader with experience managing large and complex projects across an organization.
* An excellent communicator with strong written, verbal, and presentation skills.
* A sharp thinker with exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* A strategic planner with the ability to execute on the roadmap.


**Application and position**
 The position is a permanent full-time employment with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. Selection is ongoing, so please submit your application with CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Garry Hudson, Chief Performance Officer via email garry.hudson@wmglobal.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

**Why Wavemaker you might ask?**
 Good question, our purpose is simple - to create growth for our clients by positively provoking them. Positive provocation rests on three pillars that we live by; Knowledge, Challenge and Support. If you want to gain and create knowledge from all types of data sources, including the world's largest database of information about purchase journeys, at the same time as challenging yourselves and our clients to always deliver the best results and being a team player with some of the best people and marketers around then…this job is for you!
   

  

 Wavemaker is located on Birger Jarlsgatan in Stockholm and consists of around 50 people who love to work and create magic together, generating that little extra for our clients. We also have a small office in Malmö. Since we are part of the biggest media agency group in the world, our global network gives us unique opportunities for knowledge and experience exchange.
   

  

 If, like us, you are interested in marketing that actually creates real business results for clients and you are driven and want to do things better and smarter, then we hope that you will join us!
